com.github.kmbulebu.nicknack.core.providers

Interface Provider


  • public interface Provider
    Provider Interface. Main entry point for extending NickNack. Implement to define new sets of actions and events.
    Author:
    kmbulebu

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • getUuid

        UUID getUuid()

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns:
        User friendly name of this provider. "E.g. (LCD TV Provider)"

      • getAuthor

        String getAuthor()
        Returns:
        User friendly name of person or organization who created this Provider.

      • getVersion

        int getVersion()
        Returns:
        Version of this provider. Higher versions are newer than lower versions.

      • getEventDefinitions

        Collection<EventDefinition> getEventDefinitions()
        Returns:
        A list of all possible events this provider may broadcast.

      • getActionDefinitions

        Collection<ActionDefinition> getActionDefinitions()
        Returns:
        A list of all possible actions this provider may perform.

      • getAttributeDefinitionValues

        Map<String,String> getAttributeDefinitionValues(UUID eventDefinitionUuid,
                                                UUID attributeDefinitionUuid)
        Key is the value, Value is the displayName
        Returns:
        A Map of possible values for the given attribute definition or null if the given attribute does not have a discrete list of possible values. Used only for populating a list of choices to the user while creating attribute filters.

      • run

        void run(Action action)
  throws ActionFailureException,
         ActionParameterException
        Throws:
        ActionFailureException
        ActionParameterException

      • init

        void init(org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration configuration,
          OnEventListener onEventListener)
   throws Exception
        Initializes the provider. Called when NickNack finds the provider, but before it interrogates for event definitions and action definitions.
        Throws:
        Exception
